articles.headline: Bath & Body Works Needs Holiday Shoppers. Do New Scents Draw Them In?
articles.snippet: Every year, Bath & Body Works introduces a scent that it hopes will break through during the shopping season. It doesn’t have to smell like gingerbread.
articles.abstract: Every year, Bath & Body Works introduces a scent that it hopes will break through during the shopping season. It doesn’t have to smell like gingerbread.
articles.lead_paragraph: On a Thursday evening not long before Christmas, as tourists and the after-work crowd started filling up a Bath & Body Works store near Grand Central Terminal, in Manhattan, a woman walked up to a table piled with products labeled “Perfect in Pink.”

articles.headline: Why Mergers of Carmakers Like Honda and Nissan Often Falter
articles.snippet: The Japanese companies are considering joining forces to survive in a rapidly changing auto industry, but auto history is filled with troubled and failed marriages.
articles.abstract: The Japanese companies are considering joining forces to survive in a rapidly changing auto industry, but auto history is filled with troubled and failed marriages.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Japanese automakers Honda and Nissan are discussing a possible merger, in a bid to share costs and help themselves compete in a fast-changing and increasingly competitive industry.

articles.headline: These Students Ousted a Government. Now They’re Rebuilding a Democracy.
articles.snippet: It is a daunting task for Bangladesh. But an unusual mix of young people and seasoned technocrats are determined to make the most of their opening.
articles.abstract: It is a daunting task for Bangladesh. But an unusual mix of young people and seasoned technocrats are determined to make the most of their opening.
articles.lead_paragraph: On a recent evening, in a brand-new office on the first floor of a commercial building where wires dangled from the ceiling and new flooring was still being laid, a group of university students were plotting a new future for Bangladesh.
articles.byline: By Anupreeta Das, Saif Hasnat and Atul Loke

articles.headline: He Inherited a Seat in Britain’s House of Lords. How Will It Feel to Lose It?
articles.snippet: The U.K. government has pledged to remove hereditary peers from Parliament in 2025. For Lord Cromwell and 87 others, it is a wistful departure.
articles.abstract: The U.K. government has pledged to remove hereditary peers from Parliament in 2025. For Lord Cromwell and 87 others, it is a wistful departure.
articles.lead_paragraph: Godfrey John Bewicke-Copley, the 7th Baron Cromwell, traces his family’s title back to 1375. His forebears fought the French at the Battle of Agincourt. For the last decade, Lord Cromwell’s day job has been in Britain’s House of Lords, where he mulls legislation, runs to committee meetings and briskly greets fellow lawmakers in Parliament, many of whom are elected.

articles.headline: Behind Afghanistan’s Fall, U.S.-Backed Militias Worse Than the Taliban
articles.snippet: Trump blamed Biden. Biden blamed the Afghan military. Our investigation found that the U.S. unwittingly laid the groundwork for the Taliban’s victory long ago.
articles.abstract: Trump blamed Biden. Biden blamed the Afghan military. Our investigation found that the U.S. unwittingly laid the groundwork for the Taliban’s victory long ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Taliban were inching closer, encroaching on land that had once seemed secure, the American officer warned. Four of his men had just been killed, and he needed Afghans willing to fight back.
articles.byline: By Azam Ahmed and Bryan Denton

articles.headline: Trump Will Confront a More Vulnerable but Determined Iran
articles.snippet: “Coercive diplomacy” could leave Tehran to choose either a negotiated disassembly of its nuclear capability, or a forced one.
articles.abstract: “Coercive diplomacy” could leave Tehran to choose either a negotiated disassembly of its nuclear capability, or a forced one.
articles.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump will encounter an Iran that is suddenly far more brittle than it was during his first administration, its leadership more uncertain, its nuclear program more exposed and vulnerable to attack.

articles.headline: How a Consulting Firm and Trump’s I.R.S. Pick Pushed a Problematic Tax Credit
articles.snippet: Billy Long worked with Lifetime Advisors, a company that solicited clients to claim a pandemic-era tax credit that the I.R.S. said became a magnet for fraud.
articles.abstract: Billy Long worked with Lifetime Advisors, a company that solicited clients to claim a pandemic-era tax credit that the I.R.S. said became a magnet for fraud.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Daniel Werfel, the commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service, testified before a House committee early this year, he tried to explain how a pandemic-era program had become an expensive government boondoggle.
